article.headline: St John's 68, New Jersey Tech 50
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Avery Patterson scored 23 points to help St. John's beat New Jersey Tech 68-50 on Thursday night, the Highlanders' ninth straight loss. Patterson was 5-of-12 from 3-point range and 9-of-16 overall. Anthony Mason added 11 points, and Lamont Hamilton had 10 for the Red Storm (7-3), who had a 24-20 lead at the half en route to their fourth straight win. Kraig Peters topped the Highlanders (2-9) with 14 points, while Clayton Barker followed with 12. Peters scored seven points as the visitors took a 14-6 lead. Patterson then scored the final 11 points, including three consecutive 3-pointers, in a 18-2 run that put St. John's in command 24-16. Hamilton and Patterson each had a pair of baskets as St. John's opened the second half with a 12-4 run to make it 36-24. New Jersey Tech never got closer than 36-31 on a layup by Nesho Milosevic. Larry Wright had nine points, including a pair of 3-pointers in a 13-1 surge that broke the game open at 49-32.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
